column4: HELp: ubuntu reverts to black screen after being in loading screen for about a minute, and writes: "unable to handle kernel paging request at f8c84848"
this could well be a hard drive problem
it works most of the time, but quite often like it reverts to this screen
is there a way to be sure what is the problem?
a bad sector check would do the job
can you tell how how I do this check?
I also have windows on a different hard drive
you could boot from a CD and run e2fsck -fc
e2fsck -fc device
okay, will the standard ubuntu destop CD do the job?
It's one of the options but in any case you could boot with the default option and open a terminal window
hi you still here?

great, I read to command e2fsck with the c option will also put bad sectors away, can I run the command without the c option? since this is a brand new HDD, if it's bad I'll want to return it to the store
the previous guy I asked here told me to do memtest84 so now it's done and I can check the HDD
the point of using the -c option is to check the disk's physical integrity
memtest is not a bad idea but won't find anything if the problem is the drive
it can take quite a while but is worth the try
k, will it tel me if it found something? what's annoying here is that this is a brand new HDD, and I'll be pretty pissed if it has problems :)
so I'll want to return it probably
I get your point...  it will tell you how many bad sectors were found and you'll see them showing up on the sreen as it finds them too
okay, in a normal situation it should find zero bad sectors?
